08B4787292CD4A5781C266627C210AB7.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

58DD12D66BBD420BB71825D77CA590F9.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

ED1CCAFEB65E4FCDB9705299ADF64623.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

AEB7DF4F8E4B44A3966C62BB6E364770.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

0C4EF6C6B34F456BAAF929137EE7B683.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

849B0C2829CE41CEB1395D44757E8A22.description: Relate a work placement experience to personal and career goals.

8CE862DBEAAD46EAA5BD00A0DA5F6B28.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety and networking observed during the work placement.

F54DF90273E1471799C10E6B7AA5C0B9.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

90A497ECFB0D4642B1A0A2A6342D0DAD.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

3E9FA2FE3DED44E98C2DCA325414C5A6.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

A6BFAE3C289F479E88C3796D381691F1.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

1BB74CCB2AA9447EBF2599E74D96BF15.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement

5B89437434B54B989270D6AFB8A2BD27.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

91C0F60D51FC4838BBBED23D05E58030.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?,  Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?,  Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?,  What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

CC771C601FB64CB8A1AE80E948D0734A.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

79A645C10095409990BD8B6F995684AA.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

9832CE1B02E5498F8B2BBA2A00BD0CBE.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

5806BAE56C0F4BE4B6A3C62D6F4120F4.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

531E4780AD9641B09401BD7A75FB679A.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

02F74186DE4948D7B640A81F8630381A.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

9485D3ADAFD34FBB9183F0239249627C.description: Construct costumes or set pieces for a production.

9D15FBCDF2F249D9A2D8586F7912C04F.description: Create wardrobe accessories for a specific costume.

9F8183DAEDC645649E4956D27DD16B97.description: Identify alterations required for new or existing costumes.

8536C20F097B442B96B17B8A677C9314.description: Determine the required fabric and accessories for costume or set piece creation.

AAA3C5B9782B40F7B9852A0301644DD5.description: Brainstorm different ways to create costumes considering factors such as available resources, skill level, safety, mobility

4FF818822AB1465A918B081C7C56FCE5.description: Examine the wardrobe requirements for the production (e.g., lighting, movement, costume changes, materials budget).

19143BB05E4942C1A26714446EEA5253.description: Differentiate between costuming and garment construction

3462EFBB77AF426081CB7F0DB56D1852.description: Discuss the functions (e.g., help tell a story, helps actors get into character, change an actor’s appearance) of costuming.

7DD8B32927B94CBA8B1883A5BFAD51A3.description: Create costumes, set pieces or a piece of theatre wardrobe that fulfill the requirements of a production or event.

77C34BBAABBD414196BE05F50EFCFF29.description: Design a fashion illustration using a method of choice (e.g., computer program, hand sketch).

0A433AA7235D48DDB790FBFACA2E5B83.description: Create a technical design illustration that shows construction details (e.g., darts, pockets, fastenings).

379D8ED17949438DBE561515AE81F86C.description: Design a fashion illustration (e.g., draft a sketch, use of colour and pattern).

87A7B5CA8372488A86B8478C25D9C17A.description: Investigate elements of basic garment styles and fashion silhouettes.

8070552B9DD643D59B899F8745D7ED5A.description: Explore design elements and principles as they relate to fashion.

5699E06B86DD4F799A4C0DFAD85449FB.description: Discuss the terminology associated with the fashion industry, such as classic, fad, retro.

598BEDC0AF014494B827FA84708EBF7B.description: Apply advanced sewing techniques (e.g., lining, fasteners, collars and facings) to incorporate in the project.

0C3C61C3B3FF4C81A7C8F2680052E9F2.description: Demonstrate the use construction details (e.g., gathers, darts, topstitching, variety of seams, embellishments).

FECB610C26D84E72BDE665D7130ECDFB.description: Produce a project plan, including pattern selection, fabric selection, time, budget and skill level.

983A83C0F6A6418A9E4E2499F39A15C9.description: Examine textiles suitable for the project (e.g., leather, napped, rayon, silk, fur).

C7D260E6918F4FC79F52F98B61E72D5A.description: Conduct an inquiry into resources (e.g., expenses, time management) to complete the project independently.

F5B3FCA403EE4143BA02AA2193F5F1BE.description: Construct a project from a pattern or instructions.

B7AE286B107C43248E6A2C59EFA15CBA.description: Create a simple embroidery or beadwork project (e.g., earrings, moccasins, key chain, necklace).

FE0642C934274C49B954F0EE10D82F89.description: Practise beading stitches (e.g., back stitch, halo stitch, chain stitch, lace running stitch).

27F5B8B8BD83483494C3A044673FEB20.description: Inquire into the significance of beadwork in various cultures (e.g., Métis, First Nations, Indian, Middle Eastern).

56064AC22C4A4DC08ECBD63AA6EC323F.description: Construct a design project that incorporates a variety of embroidery stitches.

0BB0A2E1E63246E08597737CE0B32577.description: Practise embroidery stitches (e.g., French knot, chain stitch, sating stitch, split stitch, lazy daisy, feather stitch).

EF1C5DC32EB7405BAA4DE5DD4E16950A.description: Practise intermediate hand sewing techniques (e.g., blind hemming, overcast stitching, ladder stitching, blanket stitching).

A54D2EB985664F878A3F03C8BDA4AC69.description: Review safety procedures as they apply to hand sewing (e.g., focus eyes on the needle, use scissors with caution).

184C9D7278A14B618CEE547AFCC80D86.description: Create a beadwork or embroidery project incorporating a variety of hand stitches.

95152DB24F3B49BAA8FD692F16562428.description: Construct an item to be donated.

7C8330ED53BA4B83B31327ED8E33D9C4.description: Construct an item for a person with specific needs.

C1000C604E8E40CDACDF614343F56698.description: Generate ideas to create a project that is economically and environmentally sustainable.

09716E4902E249E4A25B91548803253F.description: Plan a project that will meet the needs of the special interest group.

238D5C0DA75A4D2DAAE7441C5E84664A.description: Identify a special interest group (e.g., preschoolers, seniors, neonatal intensive care unit) in the school, local and/or global community that would benefit from a donation (e.g., literacy bag, teddy bear, fidget quilt).

CB96F1026D7D406AB68DED138284A3E5.description: Discuss social justice in terms of meeting the needs of others.

78B12A370BAF43AEA5039085AB5D68E3.description: Create an item to be donated for social need.

4B802ECCB0D84D8EADC1BF06BA090433.description: Practise securing a line of serging

BB9CAC04C91C45568E08E9C7DF75B601.description: Apply ergonomic recommendations when sewing, (e.g., feet flat, back straight, shoulders and neck relaxed).

396CA4F7A8F34029BAD0C76F3BB43324.description: Discuss safety procedures as they apply to serger (e.g., keep finger away from moving parts, focus eyes on the needle, use scissors with caution, turn off machine when not in use).

8F89CC12D2634B0EBC89CB1E5949DD70.description: Identify parts of a serger (e.g., thread tree, presser foot, needle, thread tension control).

FBED98F72A564251AD8A5B8101746EAC.description: Demonstrate the ability to use a serger to create a seam finish.

DC6CF7D94F36428ABC50353BF97B75A7.description: Apply the basics of operating a serger.

1E01463734EF4E4FBD12C1F7AE066CF4.description: Differentiate between a serger and a sewing machine.

20FCD707C7FC492EA12C11AFA3FE4082.description: Demonstrate safe use of a serger machine.

7879A3C5394943E69EEDE85CA300B80F.description: Examine financial and/or mental health issues related to fashion and clothing consumerism (e.g., impulse buying, shopping addiction, debt).

4D4FFDB34D164F528749D6B16AE4F4D9.description: Critique how clothing is made (e.g., labour conditions, environmental and economic impact).

923451845999481991DAA1E2B3C8466C.description: Discuss the factors involved in clothing purchases (e.g., fit, size, cost, quality).

C3CFFA5C24C44D0792F43EEBBD6DC488.description: Evaluate individual shopping practices and options (e.g., local retail, knock offs, handmade goods, online, clothing subscriptions, direct marketing).

A95FBDE4EC394F99B45A37F7A2C2978E.description: Discuss the timeline of mass production and retail of clothing and textiles.

8CD80C4C55F648D396DB4976E6F63EC3.description: Recognize the factors that contribute to purchasing clothing/textile items.

BEF7B73DFEA54D928E9E2DB076D17BDF.description: Explore ethical and sustainable factors to consider when making clothing and textile decisions.

CFFBC8B73FEB405AA1B7C217875E653F.description: Explore ways designers capitalize on name recognition.

3BC3896E15C442349A691BE0FBF4A138.description: Explore the world’s fashion centres (e.g., Paris, New York City, Montreal) and fashion associations.

E75141D3C975478C96C49A1F6253540E.description: Examine the contributions and influences of various fashion designers from past and present (e.g., haute couture, ready to wear).

82D8346F109A48BC954F09ED64D17796.description: Explore various cultures’ contributions to fashion, including First Nations, Métis and Inuit contributions.

B4F19D98010344969B81DAAAD47BBD7D.description: Research the fashions of a specific decade and compare them to the fashions of today.

B4279B52D8EB441A8A9CA378BFABF2FD.description: Investigate influences on fashion trends (e.g., media, celebrities, culture).

D0AB23F93B5944E29295EE231213E5C8.description: Identify current fashion trends and influences and how they affect one’s own personal clothing choices.

FE076FCD05674315BE05C379BCDCE3A5.description: Determine characteristics of a fashion cycle.

73CA3CAA3A694CF0997F843E61B67878.description: Explore the evolution of clothing fashion.

D0D3AFF2D849440C947F50895E1AFDEF.description: Construct quilt using basic techniques (e.g., block assembly, pressing techniques, row assembly, layering of batting, pinning, stitch in the ditch).

B42847DFAF98403C819CE8D323096E3C.description: Practise quilt finishing techniques (e.g., bias binding, attachment).

12BF775CD4D3424B9DF68F9243F8E85A.description: Apply knowledge of quilt pattern construction (e.g., cutting of fabric, notions, fabric choices, sub-cutting) to basic quilt creation.

9CCE71FA1E7241A09FC5326F09DFB546.description: Apply mathematical concepts (e.g., problem solving, estimation, measurement, pattern-making, tessellations, geometric shapes) found within the process of quilting.

36D7888F39464F2E912304A1B2219B50.description: Select a pattern (e.g., rag quilts, simple block quilts).

5974287584D74A90AE45FF8D1B65A13B.description: Examine a variety of quilting patterns (e.g., log cabin, bear paw, star) for quilt creations.

F6E289CED7D24397862409179878CF98.description: Demonstrate appropriate care and use of equipment (e.g., setting machine tension, stitch selection, proper use of machine attachments).

B178597BE7874A9D87C80762909947A0.description: Explore quilting equipment: cutting tools (e.g., rotary cutters, cutting mat); quilting tools (e.g., quilting rulers, quilting pins); and, notions (e.g., marking tools, pins).

B6107D3E392845D7B2F0FD3061AD8A7D.description: Investigate cultural and historic significance of quilting (e.g., pioneers, First Nations, Underground Railway, re-use of fabric, social significance).

BB819E7D11F74D32BEE80E345A5C9407.description: Explore traditional First Nations and Métis methods of dyeing textiles

A7F8B395ECE147C19D07D1CD8CCB5865.description: Research and evaluate fabric processing, dyeing, printing and environmental concerns (e.g., micro-fibre, fibre from plastic).

3ABA9834D6BC4DC7AFAE267B1C843AAC.description: Examine textile application in daily life (e.g., household goods, industrial use, medical application, protective gear and sporting goods).

0929431E6E5B47FE8732CB82D47D0E07.description: Investigate (e.g., purpose, cost, fabrication, care) smart wearables such as smart active wear, sleepwear and socks.

BEF69F94BB334F95866800BFED63CC67.description: Describe and evaluate a variety of fabric finishes (e.g., chemical, mechanical).

2A47198CFFFC4AB0ADD114AC0698A1F7.description: Investigate how textiles are created and changed for appropriate consumer use.

CC7907294F29487884EE156C4FB20E2C.description: Develop a plan to attain a job of personal interest in the clothing, textiles and fashion field.

9C2194FD3CCE4580974343B1A5FA36F3.description: Analyze personal suitability or non-suitability for a specific clothing, textiles and fashion related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; the work environment, including typical hours and shifts worked and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; professional and/or licensing requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and, future trends impacting the occupation.

6788240676774BDD9B6D515DCC96DF25.description: Interview or connect with others to discuss clothing, textiles and fashion related occupations.

D69F9CC34266450E9C85F3D039A2B98C.description: Identify which clothing, textiles and fashion related occupations are facing shortages and which are oversubscribed locally, regionally and/or nationally

478F1D94ADC74AD5BF145BF9FFC968BF.description: Investigate diversity (e.g., gender, cultural) in careers related to clothing, textiles and fashion in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

E68E30C4E5024D359A9E4F4AF7F0EB88.description: Investigate clothing, textiles and fashion career opportunities (e.g., costume designer, wardrobe stylist, stitcher, costume builder) in the movie industry.

23F57F9866564C3EAF19DFA4A69B1271.description: Discuss the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in clothing, textiles and fashion related careers.

0D429959281F410987E69244D510C524.description: Investigate clothing, textiles and fashion industries in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

0BB851963F4042AE8DEFAD7799E2CE65.description: Practise pressing (e.g., darts, pleats, interfacing) during project construction.

A892303F1DB94530A0756BF6B709D362.description: Apply a variety of intermediate construction details, (e.g., machine buttonholes, zippers, darts, gathering) in the creation of a sewing project.

3E42149D3DCC4CB8AAFD15166E80DA99.description: Demonstrate a variety of intermediate construction details (e.g., pleats and tucks, interfacing, sleeves) in the creation of a sewing project.

B9FC01742DC045F783BA547474E7069B.description: Demonstrate a variety of intermediate sewing techniques (e.g., gathering, hemming, constructing pockets) in the creation of a sewing project.

E556D455D5A84AAAB2608318CDE940E3.description: Practise seam finishes (e.g., edge stitched, serged).

95974CFB0E344DCA89ED297B0C9EFE57.description: Discuss and practise sewing intermediate seams (e.g., flat felled, French seam, serged).

766F667EF83B4DD99D510F04085C8D41.description: Investigate intermediate sewing techniques and construction details.

B0567DE8A6BA439289CFA55287DE9BBE.description: Create a project from a pattern or instructions.

7712D54494DD4D53835B1002A8C17DB6.description: Demonstrate intermediate sewing techniques (e.g., sleeves, zippers, buttons and buttonholes, interfacing).

CD720ACDD08F40CCBDD2BFD5F6E1E6A6.description: Experiment with various sewing tools (e.g., button spacer, tailor’s clapper, pinking scissors, chalk line tool).

AC6E83F231AE4416906115A3AB06FDE2.description: Examine textiles suitable for the project (e.g., napped, knitted, twoway stretch, satin fabrics).

166ADB5A636944B0B6E74E0E59C5157A.description: Construct a project according to the pattern selected.

9EE515AECB4B48A0969FD68E27651969.description: Demonstrate pattern layout (e.g., fabric grainline, nap, width of fabric, pattern view).

D6B393380FB547B0AEDEA1F37AAEFC42.description: Prepare fabric for sewing (e.g., preshrinking, ironing, checking grain)

4DC5CC7FCEEA4AAAAD47E0237F9334BC.description: Examine elements of the pattern instruction sheet (e.g., pattern pieces, sewing symbols).

36CC80570F6E4727B7C7AE8C57817C69.description: Investigate notions needed for garment completion (e.g., zipper, thread choice, snaps, buttons).

A589F81D32024956B0EF25A595A4353D.description: Determine body measurements to select appropriate pattern size.

FE00AD12A7F94A0BAFD58468241B57B2.description: Analyze fabric choices (e.g., cost, durability, wear ability) for chosen pattern.

99978FD7EC9D470F98C5CA00EDA2D747.description: Explore how culture might influence personal choices in patterns, fabrics and clothing shapes and lines.

2BA2E2DA5F4D40A7B2D23381710B97BA.description: Investigate how to read a pattern envelope such as fabric selection fabric recommendations and required notions.

E2303CB47CB4499684C4944A48132755.description: Explore various patterns and time allotted for garment creation.

81200315AC1E413FA3E331E5E9BFA0B4.description: Investigate the essentials of pattern selection for garment creation.
